title: Stefon Diggs salutes Cardi B’s support during first season with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "She wasn’t a football girl before I converted her over.
But, I’m just thankful to have her in my corner.
" Stefon Diggs and Cardi B welcomed a baby boy in November.

title: Massachusetts residents describe a brutal flu season as experts urge vigilance
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers Say Is this flu season actually worse than usual?
Experts and readers weigh in.
Flu and COVID vaccine shots are prepared at Boston City Hall.

title: Fire at Oakham home kills 1
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Local News Firefighters battled the blaze overnight amid single-digit temperatures.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A fire at an Oakham house early Wednesday morning claimed the life of the home’s sole resident.

title: Ex-Stoughton cop accused of killing Sandra Birchmore appears in court; defense pushes for venue change
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Lawyers for Matthew Farwell are arguing that "one-sided" media coverage in Massachusetts necessitates a move to Rhode Island for the trial.
A woman sets flowers down outside Stoughton Police Headquarters as a tribute to Sandra Birchmore in October 2024.
Craig F.

title: Downtown building may become Boston’s largest office-to-housing conversion yet
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The historic, mostly vacant office building would include over 250 apartments, with ground-floor retail.
Developers plan to convert the offices at 294 Washington St.
into residential housing.

title: Massachusetts father pleads guilty in toddler’s overdose death
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Crime The Onset man was sentenced to serve one year in jail.
Prosecutors had recommended a sentence of six to eight years in state prison.
Plymouth County District Attorney Timothy Cruz speaks to the media in November 2022.

title: Holyoke councilor under fire after body-cam video captures racist slurs, threats
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The city’s police unions are urging him to step down following his drunk-driving arrest this past December.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Massachusetts State Police arrested Holyoke City Councilor Israel Rivera in December on charges of drunk driving and running a red light.

title: Bill Burr, Conan O’Brien, Steve Carell join star-studded Netflix Is A Joke lineup
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Bill Burr, Conan O'Brien, Steve Carell, Mindy Kaling, Bill Simmons, and a trio of Barstool hosts are among the celebrities with local ties participating in Netflix Is A Joke 2026.
Conan O'Brien, Steve Carell, and Bill Burr are among the celebrities and comedians participating in Netflix Is A Joke 2026.
Andy Kropa/Invision/AP; Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP; Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images; By Kevin Slane January 21, 2026 | 1:43 PM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Turtleboy movie, docuseries in the works, production company says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Entertainment Aidan Kearney shot to national prominence for his coverage of the Karen Read murder case.
The blogger known as "Turtleboy" was jubilant as he emerged from the courthouse after the verdict in the Karen Read retrial.

Lane Turner / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin January 21, 2026 | 12:45 PM 2 minutes to read Turtleboy blogger and “Free Karen Read” champion Aidan Kearney is making the leap from livestreams to the big screen, with a docuseries in production and a feature film reportedly on the way.

title: Matt Damon explains to Joe Rogan why Netflix now makes movies for people with zero attention span
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Matt Damon told Joe Rogan that Netflix executives ask screenwriters to create excitement in "the first five minutes" of a movie and to have characters reiterate the plot "three or four times" for people looking at their phones.
Matt Damon and Ben Affleck during their appearance on "Casuals with Katie Nolan.

" Cindy Ord/Getty Images for SiriusXM By Kevin Slane January 21, 2026 | 12:25 PM 2 minutes to read Despite successfully partnering with Netflix for their new movie, “The Rip,” Matt Damon and Ben Affleck aren’t afraid to criticize the streaming giant.
